1.name: Pound
1.description: The target is physically pounded with a long tail, a foreleg, or the like.

2.name: Karate Chop
2.description: The target is attacked with a sharp chop. Critical hits land more easily.

3.name: DoubleSlap
3.description: The target is slapped repeatedly, back and forth, two to five times in a row.

4.name: Comet Punch
4.description: The target is hit with a flurry of punches that strike two to five times in a row.

5.name: Mega Punch
5.description: The target is slugged by a punch thrown with muscle-packed power.

6.name: Pay Day
6.description: Numerous coins are hurled at the target to inflict damage. Money is earned after the battle.

7.name: Fire Punch
7.description: The target is punched with a fiery fist. This may also leave the target with a burn.

8.name: Ice Punch
8.description: The target is punched with an icy fist. This may also leave the target frozen.

9.name: ThunderPunch
9.description: The target is punched with an electrified fist. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

10.name: Scratch
10.description: Hard, pointed, sharp claws rake the target to inflict damage.

11.name: ViceGrip
11.description: The target is gripped and squeezed from both sides to inflict damage.

12.name: Guillotine
12.description: A vicious, tearing attack with big pincers. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.

13.name: Razor Wind
13.description: In this two-turn attack, blades of wind hit opposing Pokémon on the second turn. Critical hits land more easily.

14.name: Swords Dance
14.description: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit. This sharply raises the user's Attack stat.

15.name: Cut
15.description: The target is cut with a scythe or claw.

16.name: Gust
16.description: A gust of wind is whipped up by wings and launched at the target to inflict damage.

17.name: Wing Attack
17.description: The target is struck with large, imposing wings spread wide to inflict damage.

18.name: Whirlwind
18.description: The target is blown away, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.

19.name: Fly
19.description: The user soars and then strikes its target on the next turn.

20.name: Bind
20.description: Things such as long bodies or tentacles are used to bind and squeeze the target for four to five turns.

21.name: Slam
21.description: The target is slammed with a long tail, vines, or the like to inflict damage.

22.name: Vine Whip
22.description: The target is struck with slender, whiplike vines to inflict damage.

23.name: Stomp
23.description: The target is stomped with a big foot. This may also make the target flinch.

24.name: Double Kick
24.description: The target is quickly kicked twice in succession using both feet.

25.name: Mega Kick
25.description: The target is attacked by a kick launched with muscle-packed power.

26.name: Jump Kick
26.description: The user jumps up high, then strikes with a kick. If the kick misses, the user hurts itself.

27.name: Rolling Kick
27.description: The user lashes out with a quick, spinning kick. This may also make the target flinch.

28.name: Sand-Attack
28.description: Sand is hurled in the target's face, reducing the target's accuracy.

29.name: Headbutt
29.description: The user sticks out its head and attacks by charging straight into the target. This may also make the target flinch.

30.name: Horn Attack
30.description: The target is jabbed with a sharply pointed horn to inflict damage.

31.name: Fury Attack
31.description: The target is jabbed repeatedly with a horn or beak two to five times in a row.

32.name: Horn Drill
32.description: The user stabs the target with a horn that rotates like a drill. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.

33.name: Tackle
33.description: A physical attack in which the user charges and slams into the target with its whole body.

34.name: Body Slam
34.description: The user drops onto the target with its full body weight. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

35.name: Wrap
35.description: A long body, vines, or the like are used to wrap and squeeze the target for four to five turns.

36.name: Take Down
36.description: A reckless, full-body charge attack for slamming into the target. This also damages the user a little.

37.name: Thrash
37.description: The user rampages and attacks for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.

38.name: Double-Edge
38.description: A reckless, life-risking tackle. This also damages the user quite a lot.

39.name: Tail Whip
39.description: The user wags its tail cutely, making opposing Pokémon less wary and lowering their Defense stat.

40.name: Poison Sting
40.description: The user stabs the target with a poisonous stinger. This may also poison the target.

41.name: Twineedle
41.description: The user damages the target twice in succession by jabbing it with two spikes. This may also poison the target.

42.name: Pin Missile
42.description: Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid succession. They hit two to five times in a row.

43.name: Leer
43.description: The user gives opposing Pokémon an intimidating leer that lowers the Defense stat.

44.name: Bite
44.description: The target is bitten with viciously sharp fangs. This may also make the target flinch.

45.name: Growl
45.description: The user growls in an endearing way, making opposing Pokémon less wary. This lowers their Attack stat.

46.name: Roar
46.description: The target is scared off, and a different Pokémon is dragged out. In the wild, this ends a battle against a single Pokémon.

47.name: Sing
47.description: A soothing lullaby is sung in a calming voice that puts the target into a deep slumber.

48.name: Supersonic
48.description: The user generates odd sound waves from its body that confuse the target.

49.name: SonicBoom
49.description: The target is hit with a destructive shock wave that always inflicts 20 HP damage.

50.name: Disable
50.description: For four turns, this move prevents the target from using the move it last used.

51.name: Acid
51.description: The opposing Pokémon are attacked with a spray of harsh acid. This may also lower their Sp. Def stat.

52.name: Ember
52.description: The target is attacked with small flames. This may also leave the target with a burn.

53.name: Flamethrower
53.description: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.

54.name: Mist
54.description: The user cloaks itself and its allies in a white mist that prevents any of their stats from being lowered for five turns.

55.name: Water Gun
55.description: The target is blasted with a forceful shot of water.

56.name: Hydro Pump
56.description: The target is blasted by a huge volume of water launched under great pressure.

57.name: Surf
57.description: The user attacks everything around it by swamping its surroundings with a giant wave.

58.name: Ice Beam
58.description: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy. This may also leave the target frozen.

59.name: Blizzard
59.description: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike opposing Pokémon. This may also leave the opposing Pokémon frozen.

60.name: Psybeam
60.description: The target is attacked with a peculiar ray. This may also leave the target confused.

61.name: BubbleBeam
61.description: A spray of bubbles is forcefully ejected at the target. This may also lower its Speed stat.

62.name: Aurora Beam
62.description: The target is hit with a rainbow-colored beam. This may also lower the target's Attack stat.

63.name: Hyper Beam
63.description: The target is attacked with a powerful beam. The user can't move on the next turn.

64.name: Peck
64.description: The target is jabbed with a sharply pointed beak or horn.

65.name: Drill Peck
65.description: A corkscrewing attack with a sharp beak acting as a drill.

66.name: Submission
66.description: The user grabs the target and recklessly dives for the ground. This also damages the user a little.

67.name: Low Kick
67.description: A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over. The heavier the target, the greater the move's power.

68.name: Counter
68.description: A retaliation move that counters any physical attack, inflicting double the damage taken.

69.name: Seismic Toss
69.description: The target is thrown using the power of gravity. It inflicts damage equal to the user's level.

70.name: Strength
70.description: The target is slugged with a punch thrown at maximum power.

71.name: Absorb
71.description: A nutrient-draining attack. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

72.name: Mega Drain
72.description: A nutrient-draining attack. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

73.name: Leech Seed
73.description: A seed is planted on the target. It steals some HP from the target every turn.

74.name: Growth
74.description: The user's body grows all at once, raising the Attack and Sp. Atk stats.

75.name: Razor Leaf
75.description: Sharp-edged leaves are launched to slash at the opposing Pokémon. Critical hits land more easily.

76.name: SolarBeam
76.description: In this two-turn attack, the user gathers light, then blasts a bundled beam on the next turn.

77.name: PoisonPowder
77.description: The user scatters a cloud of poisonous dust that poisons the target.

78.name: Stun Spore
78.description: The user scatters a cloud of numbing powder that paralyzes the target.

79.name: Sleep Powder
79.description: The user scatters a big cloud of sleep-inducing dust around the target.

80.name: Petal Dance
80.description: The user attacks the target by scattering petals for two to three turns. The user then becomes confused.

81.name: String Shot
81.description: The opposing Pokémon are bound with silk blown from the user's mouth that harshly lowers the Speed stat.

82.name: Dragon Rage
82.description: This attack hits the target with a shock wave of pure rage. This attack always inflicts 40 HP damage.

83.name: Fire Spin
83.description: The target becomes trapped within a fierce vortex of fire that rages for four to five turns.

84.name: ThunderShock
84.description: A jolt of electricity crashes down on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

85.name: Thunderbolt
85.description: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

86.name: Thunder Wave
86.description: The user launches a weak jolt of electricity that paralyzes the target.

87.name: Thunder
87.description: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to inflict damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

88.name: Rock Throw
88.description: The user picks up and throws a small rock at the target to attack.

89.name: Earthquake
89.description: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every Pokémon around it.

90.name: Fissure
90.description: The user opens up a fissure in the ground and drops the target in. The target faints instantly if this attack hits.

91.name: Dig
91.description: The user burrows, then attacks on the next turn.

92.name: Toxic
92.description: A move that leaves the target badly poisoned. Its poison damage worsens every turn.

93.name: Confusion
93.description: The target is hit by a weak telekinetic force. This may also confuse the target.

94.name: Psychic
94.description: The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force. This may also lower the target's Sp. Def stat.

95.name: Hypnosis
95.description: The user employs hypnotic suggestion to make the target fall into a deep sleep.

96.name: Meditate
96.description: The user meditates to awaken the power deep within its body and raise its Attack stat.

97.name: Agility
97.description: The user relaxes and lightens its body to move faster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.

98.name: Quick Attack
98.description: The user lunges at the target at a speed that makes it almost invisible. This move always goes first.

99.name: Rage
99.description: As long as this move is in use, the power of rage raises the Attack stat each time the user is hit in battle.

100.name: Teleport
100.description: Use it to flee from any wild Pokémon.

101.name: Night Shade
101.description: The user makes the target see a frightening mirage. It inflicts damage equal to the user's level.

102.name: Mimic
102.description: The user copies the target's last move. The move can be used during battle until the Pokémon is switched out.

103.name: Screech
103.description: An earsplitting screech harshly lowers the target's Defense stat.

104.name: Double Team
104.description: By moving rapidly, the user makes illusory copies of itself to raise its evasiveness.

105.name: Recover
105.description: Restoring its own cells, the user restores its own HP by half of its max HP.

106.name: Harden
106.description: The user stiffens all the muscles in its body to raise its Defense stat.

107.name: Minimize
107.description: The user compresses its body to make itself look smaller, which sharply raises its evasiveness.

108.name: SmokeScreen
108.description: The user releases an obscuring cloud of smoke or ink. This lowers the target's accuracy.

109.name: Confuse Ray
109.description: The target is exposed to a sinister ray that triggers confusion.

110.name: Withdraw
110.description: The user withdraws its body into its hard shell, raising its Defense stat.

111.name: Defense Curl
111.description: The user curls up to conceal weak spots and raise its Defense stat.

112.name: Barrier
112.description: The user throws up a sturdy wall that sharply raises its Defense stat.

113.name: Light Screen
113.description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from special attacks for five turns.

114.name: Haze
114.description: The user creates a haze that eliminates every stat change among all the Pokémon engaged in battle.

115.name: Reflect
115.description: A wondrous wall of light is put up to reduce damage from physical attacks for five turns.

116.name: Focus Energy
116.description: The user takes a deep breath and focuses so that critical hits land more easily.

117.name: Bide
117.description: The user endures attacks for two turns, then strikes back to cause double the damage taken.

118.name: Metronome
118.description: The user waggles a finger and stimulates its brain into randomly using nearly any move.

119.name: Mirror Move
119.description: The user counters the target by mimicking the target's last move.

120.name: Selfdestruct
120.description: The user attacks everything around it by causing an explosion. The user faints upon using this move.

121.name: Egg Bomb
121.description: A large egg is hurled at the target with maximum force to inflict damage.

122.name: Lick
122.description: The target is licked with a long tongue, causing damage. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

123.name: Smog
123.description: The target is attacked with a discharge of filthy gases. This may also poison the target.

124.name: Sludge
124.description: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may also poison the target.

125.name: Bone Club
125.description: The user clubs the target with a bone. This may also make the target flinch.

126.name: Fire Blast
126.description: The target is attacked with an intense blast of all-consuming fire. This may also leave the target with a burn.

127.name: Waterfall
127.description: The user charges at the target and may make it flinch.

128.name: Clamp
128.description: The target is clamped and squeezed by the user's very thick and sturdy shell for four to five turns.

129.name: Swift
129.description: Star-shaped rays are shot at the opposing Pokémon. This attack never misses.

130.name: Skull Bash
130.description: The user tucks in its head to raise its Defense stat on the first turn, then rams the target on the next turn.

131.name: Spike Cannon
131.description: Sharp spikes are shot at the target in rapid succession. They hit two to five times in a row.

132.name: Constrict
132.description: The target is attacked with long, creeping tentacles, vines, or the like. This may also lower the target's Speed stat.

133.name: Amnesia
133.description: The user temporarily empties its mind to forget its concerns. This sharply raises the user's Sp. Def stat.

134.name: Kinesis
134.description: The user distracts the target by bending a spoon. This lowers the target's accuracy.

135.name: Softboiled
135.description: The user restores its own HP by up to half of its max HP.

136.name: Hi Jump Kick
136.description: The target is attacked with a knee kick from a jump. If it misses, the user is hurt instead.

137.name: Glare
137.description: The user intimidates the target with the pattern on its belly to cause paralysis.

138.name: Dream Eater
138.description: The user eats the dreams of a sleeping target. It absorbs half the damage caused to heal its own HP.

139.name: Poison Gas
139.description: A cloud of poison gas is sprayed in the face of opposing Pokémon, poisoning those hit.

140.name: Barrage
140.description: Round objects are hurled at the target to strike two to five times in a row.

141.name: Leech Life
141.description: The user drains the target's blood. The user's HP is restored by half the damage taken by the target.

142.name: Lovely Kiss
142.description: With a scary face, the user tries to force a kiss on the target. If it succeeds, the target falls asleep.

143.name: Sky Attack
143.description: A second-turn attack move where critical hits land more easily. This may also make the target flinch.

144.name: Transform
144.description: The user transforms into a copy of the target right down to having the same move set.

145.name: Bubble
145.description: A spray of countless bubbles is jetted at the opposing Pokémon. This may also lower their Speed stat.

146.name: Dizzy Punch
146.description: The target is hit with rhythmically launched punches. This may also leave the target confused.

147.name: Spore
147.description: The user scatters bursts of spores that induce sleep.

148.name: Flash
148.description: The user flashes a bright light that cuts the target's accuracy.

149.name: Psywave
149.description: The target is attacked with an odd psychic wave. The attack varies in intensity.

150.name: Splash
150.description: The user just flops and splashes around to no effect at all...

151.name: Acid Armor
151.description: The user alters its cellular structure to liquefy itself, sharply raising its Defense stat.

152.name: Crabhammer
152.description: The target is hammered with a large pincer. Critical hits land more easily.

153.name: Explosion
153.description: The user attacks everything around it by causing a tremendous explosion. The user faints upon using this move.

154.name: Fury Swipes
154.description: The target is raked with sharp claws or scythes quickly two to five times in a row.

155.name: Bonemerang
155.description: The user throws the bone it holds. The bone loops around to hit the target twice—coming and going.

156.name: Rest
156.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns. This fully restores the user's HP and heals any status conditions.

157.name: Rock Slide
157.description: Large boulders are hurled at the opposing Pokémon to inflict damage. This may also make the opposing Pokémon flinch.

158.name: Hyper Fang
158.description: The user bites hard on the target with its sharp front fangs. This may also make the target flinch.

159.name: Sharpen
159.description: The user makes its edges more jagged, which raises its Attack stat.

160.name: Conversion
160.description: The user changes its type to become the same type as the move at the top of the list of moves it knows.

161.name: Tri Attack
161.description: The user strikes with a simultaneous three-beam attack. May also burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.

162.name: Super Fang
162.description: The user chomps hard on the target with its sharp front fangs. This cuts the target's HP in half.

163.name: Slash
163.description: The target is attacked with a slash of claws or blades. Critical hits land more easily.

164.name: Substitute
164.description: The user makes a copy of itself using some of its HP. The copy serves as the user's decoy.

165.name: Struggle
165.description: This attack is used in desperation only if the user has no PP. It also damages the user a little.
